content.description:
Climb the technical first section of Midget Love to the thin rail. Traverse right on thin edges to make a precarious clip. Reverse the Exacerbation crux on very thin edges to a good rail for the feet and finish as for Great Expectations. Three routes are linked using the available bolts. 
  
 Note: A second bolt has just been added to the lower half resulting in a safer climb and the R rating being removed.

See Midget Love
Four bolts and a couple of pieces for Great Expectations.

Follow long left hand dihedral to the left of the large tree around the corner (to climbers left) from Great Expectations. Easy for the first 1/3 then steepens above for a while. Layback and jam the perfect hand size crack. Crux comes where the route becomes less steep and crack thins, a few akward moves bring you to the base of a large block. Climb past the block to tree and rap hangers.

Around the corner to the left (west) of Great Expectations. Just left of large tree leaning against the cliff. Obvious dihedral is very hard to miss.
a few hand size peices for the first 2/3 and narrows to fingers for the crux. Good Pro.

Climb through the bouldery first 10' to a good stance for your first piece. Power through the crux to set yourself up for a big move to the arete and a nice jug to escape the steepness.  
  
 This is just a preview of the actual line which is to continue up the crack to micro edges and link into the offwidth roof.

To the right of The Great Roof on the steep diagonal face.
takes up to a #1.

Strat as for Great Expecations, but after 3 meters clip a bolt and make a thin traverse left to the arete. Good moves lead to the top. A fun pitch!

Take the main trial to the base and go left. The route is visible immediately.
bolts

Great Expectations is the dihedral/roof to the right of Exacerbation, It starts in the shallow crack leading up to the tiny ledge from wich you clip the first bolt (to the right) The crux is getting from the bolt to the dihedral and requires balance and footwork, once in the dihedral (which takes chocks very nicely!) layback until you are nearly at the roof. The route goes up and around the right of the roof and tops out to the right of the tree at the top.

The route just to the right of exacerbation (the bolted arete on the left)
After the one bolt at the crux some larger chocks or smallish cams are required to protect the crack in the dihedral.

Start by climbing through the small roof and mantle the bloc. This section is a V4ish problem, also height dependant. Place some gear in the crack before heading up to the bolt. The crux is the left to right traverse across the face to the next crack. You will need to place pro in this crack due to the next bolt having been removed. Continue heading right on good edges to the arete and finish up with Exacerbation. 
  
 There are a few open projects on this wall- 
  
 Project 1: Start as for Marc's Mixup but reach up to a high pocket with the left to pull yourself up onto the bloc. Clip the bolt to the right before heading up and right through the crux to gain the crack. Finish up with the Exacerbation arete. You may want to stick clip the first bolt. Blowing out of the pocket when pulling up will lead to a serious fall. 
  
 Project 2: Start as for Marc's Mixup and finish up and left using the twin cracks. Thin and technical. 
  
 Project 3: Start in the cave on the two obvious pockets.Work your way onto the bloc and link any of the routes. A V10ish or harder start. 
  
 Project 4: Start as for Marc's Mixup but skip the bloc and go directly over the roof to a small edge, match, and go for the sloping inset. Finish as for project 1.

See topo
One bolt in the middle of face and two on Exacerbation. 2-3 smallish cams for the cracks.

Start up the wide crack and traverse right to left facing scoop climb seem to top

Follow the trail in as if going to Crystal Ether, Wisecrack, Carmen etc.. You will see a prominent bouldery roof start left of that
Cams

The direct start to the Exacerbation Arete gives superb technical moves on the steep lower arete. Climb to the lone bolt on good edges then make a sequential boulder problem to better holds where Exacerbation joins the arete.

Take the main trail and stay left, the route is visible immediately.
3 bolts, a bit runout before the second bolt but the moves a fairly easy.

Climb bolted arete to the right of the large tree and Crystal Ether. Cruxy start, difficulty slowly eases as the climb progresses. Start with stellar balance moves to small ledge to rest. A few more blance moves lead to a tricky seam on the right of the arete. Finish past large ledge and huge Hueco and flake to bolted anchors.

Right of the large leaning tree and Crystal Ether. Around the corner to the left of Great Expectations.
Eight bolts and a couple small cams for the top section.

Climb Wisecrack and traverse right into the start of the crux for Vertebrae.

See topo
Gear to 2" and 6 bolts
Start as for Carmen and head straight up to the second bolt on Skyfall to bypass the first crux. The first bolt is 20' off the deck but the climbing is not too difficult.

Climb the crack immediately right of the left-hand arete until more offset cracks can be laybacked to a bolt station. Continue up the finish of Wisecrack

At the left edge of the base bluffs, left of Crystal Ether and Wisecrack and right of the impressive roof crack cave.
Gear to 1.5"

This route starts on a small pocket between Carmen and Murder in the Dark. The first crux starts just past the first bolt. Use a good pocket to set up into an iron cross using thin edges that will lead to another good pocket. The next crux is at the second bolt where a left foot, no hands dyno will get you onto a thin ledge. Traverse left from here to clip the 4th bolt on Carmen and finish as for Carmen.

Between Where in the World is Carmen Pellegrino and Murder in the Dark.
5 bolts and an optional cam for the finish. A possible ground fall before clipping the second bolt, but the climbing is not too difficult between the cruxes.

Thin face moves take you left to the arete. Than several short steps land you at a rappel anchor on top.

This route is reached by climbing Where In The World Is Carmen Pellegrino or the Arete below. Belay from the anchor on Carmen or climb as one giant pitch.
Quickdraws

The Roof corner offwidth at the left end. We don't have a lot of these around! Good leg, and ab workout. Wear pants! These can be a little difficult to grade, but this seams very consistant with Vedauwoo roof offwidth grades.

3 bolts to get you up the slab, a .75 and 1 in the ceiling before you invert. 2 #6's are nice, then you dont have to walk. After some severe problems having the #4 lipcam rip out, or invert and completely weld the rope to the point of having to untie to get to the station, a bolt was placed at the lip instead of the #4.

Climb the bolted arete left of Crystal Ether and right of Wisecrack to a chain station on the ledge 25 m off the ground. A potential continuation up the arete above the station will be much, much harder. 
  
 Steady climbing with two balancy cruxes, foot work dependent. The grade may change a bit over time as some of the hand holds use grainy flakes.

Single rope gets you down. Lowering will put you at the base of Rapidfire, well to the left.
10 bolts, rap chain and ring station at top.

climbs.name: Where in The World Is Carmen Pellegrino?

content.description:
This has two possible starts. Either move up the first few meters of Crystal Ether and take a right-angling crack to the ledge or climb up a curving flake to the right and from its top, step left to the same ledge. The old giant log which used to mark this route is gone since 2016 thanks to some rope rigging and a powerful winch.

Now climb off the ledge up a bolted face. The crux comes at a huge pocket which you mantle and then undercling. Easier climbing above and below.

Just right of Crystal Ether
6 or 7 bolts. Left hand start takes good gear 1/2" to 2". Right hand (original) start is poorly protected but takes a nut in the groove at top of the flake before stepping left. Rap anchors on top (shared with Murder in the Dark).

Climb the left-leaning straight in crack. Where it thins, reach left to another crack and continue up that, passing the bolt belay for Rapidfire, then finish up a dihedral left of the finishing dihedral of Crystal Ether.

Left of Crystal Ether is a square-cut flat face. Rapidfire is on the left arete of this (right of the cave) and Wisecrack takes the center of the face. Newly rescrubbed for 2011.
Gear to 2"
The left side ofFrom The Ground up, left of the fixed rope and running from Great Expectations across the base left to the Rapidfire area.
